results.title: Tomorrow by air
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”
At the end of WWII, the British aircraft industry was faced with the problems of making a swift changeover from wartime to peacetime aircraft production. Since the end of the war, the British aviation and aircraft industry has attempted to take the lead in the production of fast planes, particularly jet planes, large freight planes, and passenger planes (eg the Brabazon, still in the process of being built when this film was made), and in the general problems of aeronautics and aviation research.

results.title: Tomorrow begins today
results.creator_credit: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
results.brief_description: Dealing with the refugee problem in the Middle East, including the difficulties faced by the children. As a result of armed conflict in 1948 in the Holy Land, nearly one million Arabs became refugees. This film shows the steps taken by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency to help in educating and resettling these people.

results.title: Tomorrow and yesterday
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”
The Japanese are well known for their ancient civilisation with its tradition and brilliant festivals as well as its high technology and future-oriented attitudes. This film shows how the two meet.

results.title: Tomorrow's world
results.brief_description: Looks at the world population situation. Examines the history of world population growth, food production, and family planning schemes in the third world. Contrast family planning programs in Tunisia and Thailand and outlines various methods of family planning. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Tomorrow's today
results.creator_credit: Park Film Studios and Henry Lewes
results.brief_description: A film record of children’s paintings, showing the manner in which the environment effects the choice of subject and the style of work itself. The paintings come from school children in the East End of London and provide a grim picture of the daily scene that confronts them.

results.title: Tomorrow's salmon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nielsen-Ferns International and Michael Maltby
results.brief_description: The film describes the joint program of the Canadian and British Columbian governments to protect and strengthen stocks of Pacific salmon on which depend, either directly or indirectly, the jobs of 75,000 people and a $250 million industry. Well-documented and visually satisfying, the film alerts its audience to the necessity of sound conservation practices.

results.title: Tomorrow's quake
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall
results.brief_description: This film explores efforts to develop hypotheses on earthquake prediction. Explains continental drift, dilatency, plate techtonics, earthquake mechanics, seismographs, P and S waves, Seismic velocity changes, tilimeters, ground elevation, water wells and unusual animal behaviour.

results.title: Tomorrow's end. Episodes 7-12
results.brief_description: The final six half-hour episodes of “Tomorrow’s End” continue the story of brother and sister, Petey and Janey Kelly, and their futuristic adventures with the Girl from Tomorrow, Alana, to foil the evil Silverthorn and his plans to use Alana’s time capsule to alter history and destroy the world with nuclear weapons. In the end, the young trio triumph. Alana returns to her world and the Kellys to theirs, but they will never forget their travels together through time.
